reviews.text: We got snowed in, in Gatlinburg, and although we LOVED the Lodge at Buckberry Creek, we wanted to get a little closer to downtown in case we were not able to drive.
reviews.title: Nice for the price
Midtown Lodge - room was gross/location great
reviews.text: Midtown was right in the MIDDLE of everything. We walked everywhere which was nice. THey let us look at two rooms to decide what we wanted. All the rooms ranged from $65-85. We looked at a two story townhome and a tower suite. We decided on the tower suite, despite the fact it was smaller, it was cleaner and had more natural light. The couch was a bit old, and the bed could have been a little more comfortable (granted we DID just come from the Lodge at Buckberry! and paid 3X's the amount!) but for the price, it is a nice and easy hotel. Great if you have kids b/c it has a lot of room and close to everything.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: They had coffee and Krispy Kreme doughnuts for us in the morning with a HUGE fireplace in the lobby to enjoy it by.

Great downtown location - can walk everywhere. The rooms need a serious upgrade. Room was tiny, had odor and we were scared to touch anything! If rooms were upgraded this would be a great place to stay because of the location.
reviews.title: Old,convienent,very nice staff!

reviews.text: We had come from a terrible hotel that was $100 a night, supposed to be wonderful and the room was filthy and nasty. We finished our trip up with Midtown Lodge, I remembered staying there with my family when I was younger, and I must say that my family and I was pleased with everything about it. The hotel staff was wonderful, the rooms were so clean and the shower felt nice. We fully intend on staying there again. The only drawback was that the room did feel a little old, but still nice nonetheless.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay
nice place to stay
reviews.text: My family stayed at Midtown Lodge July 1-4, in their Townhouse. Room was clean, and overlooked the pool, which was nice. Staff very friendly at check in and check out. The room was supposed to have a king bed up in the loft, but instead had 2 double beds. I didn't complain about it even though we would rather have the king bed. On the minus side -- one of the couches had a couple of small holes on the armrest and both bedspreads did look a bit old and outdated and there were patched places in the carpet that weren't glued down, and would come up if you scuffed your shoe across it. Plus side -- there were plenty of towels, and the kitchen area had a refridgerator, microwave, stove, plates, glasses and silverware. It was nice to be in the center of town, easy access to everything. I would stay here again. If they would replace the carpet, and update the bedspreads and couch, this place would be Awesome!

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: i have stayed at Midtown Lodge several times and it has always been great. They have several rooms in what they call The Tower. You have a fireplace and a small kitchen. The staff has always been very friendly and always ready to help with any concerns you may have. Would definitely recommend it anytime.
